measured_by: case review duration (time to review each slide)
justification: "If participants had an implicit memory of the case, we expected faster reviews in Phase 2 for repeated versus novel cases," indicating that review time served as the operational measure of implicit memory.
construct: Implicit memory for digital pathology cases

measured_by: subjective case difficulty rating (6-point Likert scale)
justification: The authors state they "examined subjective ratings of difficulty… If participants had an implicit memory of the case, we expected… lower difficulty rating," showing that the Likert difficulty scale was used to index implicit memory.
They also "examined… diagnostic confidence for each case… expected… higher confidence" for repeated cases, using the confidence Likert scale as a measure of implicit memory effects.

measured_by: 6-point Likert difficulty scale (very easy to very challenging)
justification: After each case, participants answered "Please rate… the level of diagnostic difficulty of this case" on a six-point Likert scale, explicitly tying the construct of perceived difficulty to this instrument.

measured_by: 6-point Likert confidence scale (not at all confident to very confident)
justification: Participants were asked to "rate… your confidence in your assessment" on a six-point Likert scale, making this the instrument used to measure diagnostic confidence.
